title: Why do ADC's have the cheapest item path, do the most damage with autos, and have supports?
body: Can someone explain this to me? This doesn't even cover how they get supports who buy them defensive items like Night's Vow or playmaking items like Zeke's.

replies.body:
If ADCS were as op as Boards think they are they would be played in every single role and this would be the meta:
 
Top:{{champion:67}} Impossible to reach, has a dash, stealth and her E while she melts you with 3 aa.

Jng{{champion:29}} Also stealth, free gank at lvl2 with Red. He just rightclicks with his R and gets a penta.

Mid{{champion:498}} she just 2 shots eveyone with Shyv+EReaver, she gets free mana per crit so she never goes oom and has a out of jail ultimate to stop any engage.

Bot{{champion:18}} Most braindead champ of the game, longest jump that ignores CC at the start, she pushes you away with her R and everything she has is rightclick= no skill. And highest range of the game for aa.

Sup{{champion:21}} She takes half of your hp with a good bounce and builds ap and lethality to melt your team with only her R, just unfair.

And most important, all their items are cheap as fk + they don't need to land skillshots or anything just rightclick and you win free elo. What can go wrong with this team?

Not to support the arguments of stupid people but we actually had this once around beginning of season 6 where you were guaranteed to have 2 adcs minimun in every game. 3 adcs wasn´t a rare sight either.

> [{quoted}](name=no to toxic,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dmo48zl9,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2018-03-19T14:37:23.543+0000)
>
> Not to support the arguments of stupid people but we actually had this once around beginning of season 6 where you were guaranteed to have 2 adcs minimun in every game. 3 adcs wasn´t a rare sight either.

You are right, but it's needed to say which adcs were the ones played besides botlane: Reworked Graves Jng or Top, reworked Quinn Top or Jng (sometimes Mid), also Kindred was meta and reworked Corky Midlane.

 It's not that adcs like Ashe or Cait were played Mid or Top for example.
I'm still not sure why AD casters like MF or Jhin don't appear in mid more often.
Immobile.

Adding to this, immobile and defenseless.

Take any immobile mage not named Aurelion and they have some form of immediate CC or upfront burst to turn around a fight.

Take MF and look at her general direction and her main defense is (try to) run away.

> [{quoted}](name=It Hertz When IP,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dmo48zl9,comment-id=0003000000000000,timestamp=2018-03-19T18:40:06.442+0000)
>
> I'm still not sure why AD casters like MF or Jhin don't appear in mid more often.

Because they would die to almost every single gank maybe, I'm also not sure about that but as a MF player I should try her Mid just for the science, I think that it can work with a jng with CC since her R needs the Support's CC most times when I play her bot.

You still see multiple adc's way too often in this game. Just saying. 

(But it's the supports who are broken tbh)

then assassins became counter picks and thus started the chant...... 'adc 2k17' 
History kids

Thats wrong. It started in the iceborn sunfire tabis tank meta where every non lethality marksmen didn´t scale fast enough to ever become a threat to  tanks like Ekko, Maokai, Fizz and Poppy. Then after the lethality nerfs Ziggs went bot since he was could take towers didn´t need 30 min to scale in a meta where every had their powerspikes at 1 item. The only marksmen in that period wich was a safe and dominant enough pick to ever be considered in pro play was Caitlyn and Ezreal everything else was basically giving up in LCS. So no assasins never became meta last year except after the assasin rework with tank Rengar, 1 shot E LeBlanc and Kazhix even if nothing really changed about him, but that didn´t last very long except for Rengar building less tank items with every nerf. This was also all before the support item changes and the ardent meta.

It started in the armor stacking meta when adcs decided they wanted to build flat armor pen assassin items over intended overbuffed adc items??????
adcs now build {{item:3031}}  {{item:3086}}  and steam roll the game from there has there been any changed to these items since that time?
Tank ekko was a season 5 meme where ekko built his intended secondary fighter build  (though not as it was intended as instead of {{item:3078}}  he was supposed to opt into ap items like {{item:3165}}  and {{item:3115}}  back then)  but adcs were crying cause ekko wasnt as squishy as he is when he builds assassin (wonder what you expected defensive stats to do)  engages with his e (which is wicked low cooldown because assassin was his primary) and if he got low he got out with his ult which made them feel bad that their 5 shots didnt end up in a kill because they didnt account for his excape ability.
I never said assassins were meta lethality items and certain assassins were reworked at the end of novemeber of 2016  and people were trying out the new assassins and thus you got them in 3 rolls until supports realised they were forced to be the front line or would be focused by default and thus supports picked assassins too thus you had 4 assassin 1 adc teams on boths sides and thus the adc was the focus of all the assassins by default and even then they would take down 2 of the 4 with them before they went down. thus they cried adc 2k17 why should i the most powerful role on either team be focused when you keep nerfing everyone who protects them except Lux and Morgana thus no one wants to play those champions.

> [{quoted}](name=LordGeovanni,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dmo48zl9,comment-id=00030000000200000000,timestamp=2018-03-22T04:35:10.032+0000)
>
> It started in the armor stacking meta when adcs decided they wanted to build flat armor pen assassin items over intended overbuffed adc items??????
> adcs now build {{item:3031}}  {{item:3086}}  and steam roll the game from there has there been any changed to these items since that time?
> Tank ekko was a season 5 meme where ekko built his intended secondary fighter build  (though not as it was intended as instead of {{item:3078}}  he was supposed to opt into ap items like {{item:3165}}  and {{item:3115}}  back then)  but adcs were crying cause ekko wasnt as squishy as he is when he builds assassin (wonder what you expected defensive stats to do)  engages with his e (which is wicked low cooldown because assassin was his primary) and if he got low he got out with his ult which made them feel bad that their 5 shots didnt end up in a kill because they didnt account for his excape ability.
> I never said assassins were meta lethality items and certain assassins were reworked at the end of novemeber of 2016  and people were trying out the new assassins and thus you got them in 3 rolls until supports realised they were forced to be the front line or would be focused by default and thus supports picked assassins too thus you had 4 assassin 1 adc teams on boths sides and thus the adc was the focus of all the assassins by default and even then they would take down 2 of the 4 with them before they went down. thus they cried adc 2k17 why should i the most powerful role on either team be focused when you keep nerfing everyone who protects them except Lux and Morgana thus no one wants to play those champions.

I can´t understand what you wrote. You word everything in such a confusing way that my non native english mind can´t follow. Also tank ekko was season 6.

Tank ekko was season 5 that spilled over into season 6 just like adc crit changes (the second one where they made essence reaver a great bruiser buy an adc only crit item) were season 5  (preseason 6) spilling into season 6.
Hell i saw the first adc 2k16 meme (complaint) in November not even days after the assassin rework.

Saying that a class is OP doesnt mean that they would be as good if played in every role.  ADCs are as good as they are atm because they have cheap itemization which scales incredibly hard, supports that can protect them with skills and itemization and tanks to front line for them.

5 ADCs are ok, but not even nearly as good as one ADC which is held up on the backs of their support+tank

You mean supports that would be deleted after their cc even when building tank or if they dont cc the enemy adc except their adc deletes the enemy adc first and thus they can survive for 4 seconds longer

> do the most damage with autos

What is the point of this exactly? Like no shit? That's like me saying "why do tanks survive the longest" or "why do assassins have burst"
And?
Theres no outplay to it if you get rightclicked u die, half of them have gap closers or something to stick to you aswell. Thats the point trying to be made
Because they need more items to be viable. It's not just "Add one 2400g item and you matter", it's "add 6000g worth of items and you actually become somewhat relevant".
{{sticker:zombie-brand-facepalm}}
I'm not sure who you're facepalming at. Me? Or at how OP missed this super obvious thing?

Yeah so fking fair to be at late game with 6k gold. So he is obviously facepalming you. There is a reason why some champions spike on one 3k+ gold item. Those champions are mostly early to mid game champions. It's their role to be strongest earlier.adcs should be the strongest in late after 4/5 items. Currently you are basically full build at 2 items which doesn't give time for early/mid game champions to be relevant and lately late game carries are also decently strong in early/mid as well. So having the cheapest items for the easiest method of dealing DMG is ridiculous.

Are we playing the same game? ADC's need three items to do serious damage, and that's assuming they don't get blown up by the enemy mid laner. Also, if ADC's needed 4 items to be relevant, no one would play them. Games are almost always decided by the 25 minute mark.

Somehow in S4 ADCs were good after 4 items and they were pretty much doing fine and still mandatory pick. Nobody was saying ADCs are weak. Games are decided by 25 minutes because ADCs are allowed to snowball so hard.

I mean he has a point. Adcs usually needs a combination of at least 2 items to have relevancy. Typically a Zeal and a damage item.

Sure Jhin can get RFC quickly, Jinx IE somewhat quickly, but Jhin won't do any damage just from RFC and Jinx can't shred tanks and squishies with just a damage item.

Because they would be useless otherwise. They are glass cannons, the supports are there to keep them safe. 
Also they dont have the cheapest item paths, that doesnt make any  sense at all. Pretty much all other roles have cheaper paths.

The only roles with cheaper paths are supports and tanks

{{item:3031}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3087}}{{item:3072}}{{item:3036}}{{item:3006}}= 16000 gold

Mages are about even now since the item rework
{{item:3907}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3003}}{{item:3157}} {{item:3135}}{{item:3020}} =16250

Bruisers have the most expensive by far 
{{item:3078}}{{item:3748}}{{item:3053}}{{item:3143}}{{item:3065}}{{item:3047}} =17233

This is almost entirely because {{item:3094}} and {{item:3087}} are some of the cheapest finished items in the game

> [{quoted}](name=Auz the Ripper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dmo48zl9,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-03-19T14:35:01.600+0000)
>
> The only roles with cheaper paths are supports and tanks
> 
> {{item:3031}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3087}}{{item:3072}}{{item:3036}}{{item:3006}}= 16000 gold

> {{item:3907}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3003}}{{item:3157}} {{item:3135}}{{item:3020}} =16250

> {{item:3078}}{{item:3748}}{{item:3053}}{{item:3143}}{{item:3065}}{{item:3047}} =17233
> 
> This is almost entirely because {{item:3094}} and {{item:3087}} are some of the cheapest finished items in the game

dude your wrong
adc full build is infnity edge+RFC+Static shiv
acutly with only infinity edge and rfc they start one shoting pepole from 750 range
Got any video of that? those are some pretty out there claims

The typical ADC with those three items would have ~190-210 ad. The most you would get with a crit is maybe 700 damage. Considering most champs have about 20-30 % damage reduction via armor and MR base, it would be closer to 400-500 damage at most.
And that's with 3 items, he was talking about just IE and and RFC.
Oh, well either way the point of my post is valid (that his statement that the two items will one shot a player). If the 3 couldn't, the two wouldn't either.

Oh dont get me wrong, i agree with you.
I was just pointing out how much bullshit he was spewing (like most circle jerkers).
That’s tank with a cleaver
thats a jax with a plan
it would be a fairly dead jax with no life steal, very little attack speed, no Sheen-based items and there are probably more problems to add onto it XD

> [{quoted}](name=Auz the Ripper,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dmo48zl9,comment-id=00020000,timestamp=2018-03-19T14:35:01.600+0000)
>
> The only roles with cheaper paths are supports and tanks
> 
> {{item:3031}} {{item:3094}} {{item:3087}}{{item:3072}}{{item:3036}}{{item:3006}}= 16000 gold
> 
> Mages are about even now since the item rework
> {{item:3907}} {{item:3089}} {{item:3003}}{{item:3157}} {{item:3135}}{{item:3020}} =16250
> 
> Bruisers have the most expensive by far 
> {{item:3078}}{{item:3748}}{{item:3053}}{{item:3143}}{{item:3065}}{{item:3047}} =17233
> 
> This is almost entirely because {{item:3094}} and {{item:3087}} are some of the cheapest finished items in the game

 "Only roles with cheaper paths are supports and tanks" well, brusiers are more expensive but a riven w/ black clever or a nasus wit tri force is a hell of alot more scary than an ashe with essence reaver. ADC's generally need 2-3 4 if your names sivir items to be really scary, Bruisers only need 1 or 2 in all honesty. Mages are similar but the cost is the same so I dont see much of an issue w/ that.  Also, keep in mind its not uncommon to go bf sword into a zeal item. This means the zeal item being cheaper just means ADC's don't end up waiting an extra 5 minutes for an item while being useless because they only have AD or AS. Lets them build both for atleast some respectable early game damage for team fights without being behind in the overall course of the game.

Its because the items on their own dont do anything

So, {{item:3031}}  needs Attacks Speed and Crit to be effective.
but then {{item:3086}} items need AD to be effective.

So almost every ADC needs 5000g worth of items to hit their first spike, whereas other roles need {{item:3071}} or{{item:3147}} or {{item:3285}} so other people hit their spike for like 60% of the gold, on one item.

They dont do the most damage, have you ever played this game? Mages always out damage ADC, Tanks can easily take down an ADC, Juggernauts usually 2 hit an ADC, Assassins can 1 shot every fight after one item, Bruisers 1 shot after their item. An ADC cant exist near anyone in this game without a full team that knows what they're doing, or an enemy team full of apes.

And ADC needs support cause without a support, an ADC is useless til 6 items. People act like ADC is the most broken thing in this game when its the furthest thing from true, they need an entire role devoted to helping them early game, or else they get destroyed with little effort.

The boards is like an alternate dimension i swear to god, i have NEVER seen anyone in an actual game say ADC is broken, people still meme about how bad it feels to play, but on the boards, you all act like its 1 shotting everything without counterplay. Settle down with the circle jerk already.
Assassin assassinating a ADC with 1 item ha. If there is a Janna, Lulu or any CC support good luck even getting onto the ADC nonetheless one shotting.
Obviously you wouldn't dive in 1v2 when they have their abilities up and they're not distracted. At that point you're asking to be Exhausted and killed.
{{item:3147}} literally 30% of an ADCs health with an auto

> So, ie  needs Attacks Speed and Crit to be effective.

True but its not like ie is on its own. Besides there are a lot of items that need each other to be effective.  In order to make full use of, lets say deathcap, you need a lot of ap and % magic penetration. 

>  So almost every ADC needs 5000g worth of items to hit their first spike,

I didnt know statikk costed 5k g.  And btw thats not a first spike.  That is the  2nd or 3rd. 

>  whereas other roles need bc or duskblade or ludens

Wherever the others role need to risk their position to make use of their kit (or in case of mages they have cds, mana and usually their spells have some form of counterplay usually in the form of sidestepping it)

>  They dont do the most damage, have you ever played this game? Mages always out damage ADC

Well mages no not really. And even if they end up dealing more damage than the adc its because they have more aoe than adcs. Plus the fact that their enemies will rarely build a 2nd mr item. 

>  Tanks can easily take down an ADC

Too bad it wont happen if the adc has lifesteal or has company. Or is vayne. 

>  Juggernauts usually 2 hit an ADC

Not true at all. Unless the juggy is way ahead, he will never 2 shot the adc. On the same exp and same item number, he wont 2 hit him.  And lets not forget, juggies lack the tools to reach the adc. (unless the juggy is a nasus with glory)

>   An ADC cant exist near anyone in this game without a full team that knows what they're doing

Thats not adc exclusive. This applies to everyone.

>  And ADC needs support cause without a support, an ADC is useless til 6 items

And after that they become the highest and most reliable source of dmg, essentially forcing the mage in his team to mostly exist so that (the mage) forces their enemies to invest in mr instead of armour. 

>   People act like ADC is the most broken thing in this game when its the furthest thing from true,

Well its a mix of that, and the frustration of being unable to act.  That shitty feeling of having to endure a jinx's rockets. With a cd of a single second. 

> you all act like its 1 shotting everything without counterplay

Well they dont 1 shot. They shoot a (usually) fast barrage of undodgable aa that deal shittons of damage unless you are a tank.

1. Wtf do you mean "risk their position"? His point you cited was talking about costs for power spike, not map control
2. No shit stattik doesnt cost 5k
3. The point of some champions is to exist next to the enemy so that they can't do anything. Have you heard of tanks? Maybe Braum? Or a golden Fiddlesticks?
4. Of course juggernauts won't 2 shot an adc, he's just saying that adcs can be killed if left alone
5. Juggernauts aren't just Nasus, they include Udyr, Darius and Trundle. And Nasus DOES have a tool that helps him catch adcs, its called Wither

I’ve said it before and I’ll say it again, from a balance perspective, it makes zero sense as to why there’s a single item build that’s more expensive than an adc’s, considering they have the highest ceiling in terms of overall power(aka scaling), this the title “carry”. imo they should reduce bruiser build gold to around 16k and move adc build gold to 17.5 along with the slated statikk nerfs that would make adc’s balanced imo
ahh yes one crit item is stronger then a black cleaver or trinity force on it´s own it all makes sense now god thing I lack the braincells to question this falwed argument

> [{quoted}](name=no to toxic,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dmo48zl9,comment-id=00080000,timestamp=2018-03-19T16:17:47.444+0000)
>
> ahh yes one crit item is stronger then a black cleaver or trinity force on it´s own it all makes sense now god thing I lack the braincells to question this falwed argument

One thing you seem to be missing is that an adcs items multiply each others power whereas a bruisers does not, which must be considered when balancing

Another thing to consider is that cleaver and trinity aren’t the only items I’m talking about, imo hydra should be cheaper, steraks should be cheaper, DMP should be cheaper etc

Do you even think about the items you want to be cheaper offering more things than damage. Did you notice the health on them or their passives. Of course you didn´t you just wanna prove an argument by pretending damage is the be all end all of league where al other stats dont exist and don´t matter
